etymologies: Middle English (denoting material for making clothes): shortening of Old French estoffe ‘material, furniture’, estoffer ‘equip, furnish’, from Greek stuphein ‘draw together’

definitions: matter, material, articles, or activities of a specified or indeterminate kind that are being referred to, indicated, or implied

examples.text: she's good at the technical stuff
a pickup truck picked the stuff up

shortDefinitions: matter, material, articles, or activities of specified or indeterminate kind that are being referred to

definitions: a person's belongings, equipment, or baggage

examples.text: he took his stuff and went

shortDefinitions: person's belongings or baggage

definitions: worthless or foolish ideas, speech, or writing; rubbish

examples.text: stuff and nonsense!

shortDefinitions: worthless or foolish ideas or writing

definitions: drink or drugs

examples.text: the islanders get fighting mad on the stuff
“Are you doing stuff, Kevin?” he asked

shortDefinitions: drink or drugs

definitions: things in which one is knowledgeable and experienced; one's area of expertise

examples.text: he knows his stuff and can really write

shortDefinitions: things in which one is knowledgeable and experienced

definitions: the basic constituents or characteristics of something or someone

examples.text: Healey was made of sterner stuff
such a trip was the stuff of his dreams

shortDefinitions: basic constituents or characteristics of something or someone

definitions: woolen fabric, especially as distinct from silk, cotton, and linen

examples.text: her dark stuff gown

shortDefinitions: woollen fabric

definitions: (in sports) spin given to a ball to make it vary its course.
shortDefinitions: (in sport) spin given to ball to make it vary its course

definitions: a pitcher's ability to produce spin on a ball or control the speed of delivery of a pitch.
shortDefinitions: player's ability to produce such spin

definitions: fill (a receptacle or space) tightly with something

examples.text: an old teapot stuffed full of cash
his head has been stuffed with myths and taboos

shortDefinitions: fill receptacle or space tightly with something

definitions: force or cram (something) tightly into a receptacle or space

examples.text: he stuffed a thick wad of cash into his jacket pocket

shortDefinitions: force or cram something tightly into receptacle or space

definitions: hastily or clumsily push (something) into a space

examples.text: Sadie took the coin and stuffed it in her coat pocket

shortDefinitions: hastily force something into space

definitions: fill out the skin of (a dead animal) with material to restore the original shape and appearance

examples.text: he took the bird to a taxidermist to be stuffed

shortDefinitions: fill out skin of dead animal with material

definitions: fill (the cavity of an item of food) with a savory or sweet mixture, especially before cooking

examples.text: chicken stuffed with mushrooms and breadcrumbs

shortDefinitions: fill cavity of item of food with savoury or sweet mixture

definitions: fill (oneself) with large amounts of food

examples.text: he stuffed himself with potato chips

shortDefinitions: fill oneself with large amounts of food

definitions: fill (envelopes) with identical copies of printed matter

examples.text: they spent the whole time in a back room stuffing envelopes

shortDefinitions: fill envelopes with identical copies of printed matter

definitions: place bogus votes in (a ballot box).
shortDefinitions: place bogus votes in

definitions: used to express indifference toward or rejection of (something)

examples.text: stuff the diet!

shortDefinitions: used to express indifference towards or rejection of

definitions: defeat heavily in sport

examples.text: Town got stuffed every week

shortDefinitions: defeat heavily in sport

definitions: (of a man) have sex with (someone).
shortDefinitions: (of man) have sex with
